Description:
Are you a passionate Data Engineer?
Do you thrive as a member of a cross functional team?
Based at our Petone office, with flexible working arrangements available
This full-time, permanent position. The remuneration for this role is from $95,000 to $132,000 (including Kiwisaver) depending on skills and experience.
Who are we
Not only is water our most precious resource but it's a hot topic in the Wellington region and nationally. As a trusted advisor to the region's Councils, we partner with the community, engineering consultants and contractors to deliver drinking water, wastewater and storm water services from source to sea.
The opportunity
As part of Digital Products and Services, you will be responsible for analysing, designing, developing, integrating and automating user friendly digital products and services that are aligned with the organisational business outcome. As our Backend specialist, you will manage the ingestion and automation of different data sources into the organisational data storage platform.
At Wellington Water the need to access and utilise good quality data and information is increasingly important across all roles in our business, for the delivery of our services and the way we work together. The new water regulations are amplifying the role our data and information assets play in informing our priorities, operating efficiently, and demonstrating compliance.


The Ideal candidate will have a have a tertiary qualification in computer science, or other relevant field. You will also have strong written, oral and interpersonal communication skills on top of an excellent customer focus to complement your ability to build effective peer and working relationships. You'll also be able to adjust your personal style and approach as appropriate to the situation; all enabling you to effectively cope with change and handle risk and uncertainty.
What's in it for you
It's an exciting time to join our organisation. We have some big aspirations to continue an innovative center of excellence for the management of three waters in the region. Your personal and professional growth will be encouraged, and you will work alongside likeminded people who are passionate about their work and have a strong sense of purpose for the region and its councils.
To view a copy of our benefits please copy and paste the URL below into your internet browser's address bar: https://careers.wellingtonwater.co.nz/
Applications close at 5pm on Thursday, 20 April 2023.
We will be reviewing and progressing applications as they are received, so don't delay, get your application in now!
To view a copy of the position description please copy and paste the URL below into your internet browser's address bar: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TMNBI-ZHx5if-1_9wTvhfSqMpHz9gC6O/view?usp=share_link
To apply for the role, click on the 'apply' button or visit the Wellington Water careers site.
JoinUs@wellingtonwater.co.nz
Applicants will be required to undergo drug and alcohol testing prior to commencing employment with Wellington Water. You must also be legally entitled to work long-term in New Zealand.

Description:
Your work days are brighter here.
At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.
About the Team
Workday is looking for a Senior Software Development Engineer to join our Performance Engineering team! Performance Engineers are highly skilled engineers who debug, measure, analyze, and improve our Workday software.
They are generalists with deep technical understanding of software, distributed systems, cloud computing, cloud technologies, deployment, hardware, networking, and the Internet. They enjoy taking a holistic view of complex systems. Application Performance is achieved by working closely with all our engineering teams throughout the release cycle.

Our ultimate goal is application performance that yields an excellent end user experience and scales to meet Software as a Service Infrastructure needs.

Description:
Help us make a big green dent in the universe. We're on a mission to drive the global renewable energy revolution, and we need loads more people to help us make our vision a reality.

Our team
All technology is written and maintained by a multi-discipline engineering team of around 300 people globally. This includes server-side, client-side and mobile engineers working closely with UX experts, copywriters and designers.
We follow a Kanban-like approach, using Google docs and Trello to specify and manage work; Github, CircleCI and Terraform Enterprise as part of an immutable-infrastructure, continuous delivery pipeline; and Loggly, Sentry and Cloudwatch to measure performance and monitor production.

Engineering standards are high. We pair program, thoroughly review and test code before it deploys, and maintain fast, high-value test suites. We have weekly tech talks, monthly blitz-days (eg sharpening our internal tools, upgrading dependencies) and can often be found at tech meet-ups and conferences.

If you are this someone, Thematic is looking for you!
About Thematic
Thematic is a SaaS platform for customer feedback analysis, powered by the latest AI algorithms. Our goal is to empower companies to get clear and accurate insights from customer feedback in a fast and effortless way. We work with the likes of Google, LinkedIn, Atlassian and Doordash (just to name a few). Our users are researchers, analysts and product operations people. Description:
The Company
A better understanding of the Earth creates a better world for all. Seequent brings together industry-leading earth modelling, geo-data management, and team collaboration software.

Because when everyone can see the full picture, they can make better decisions that benefit people and the planet.

Every day, our customers in over 100 countries work to develop vital mineral resources more sustainably, design and build better infrastructure, protect the environment, source renewable energy, and help resolve historical challenges such as groundwater contamination and ageing infrastructure.

We’re here to help them. That why we’re constantly evolving at the forefront of technology and geoscience – from Cloud accessibility, to 3D modelling, to digital collaboration.

Headquartered in New Zealand with our team located in 25 locations around the world, Seequent is a high growth, people-centric success story. We’re passionate, curious, Earth lovers.

Ready to help change the world? Join us.

We are looking for 7 Software engineers to work with our team.

Precision Data are working closely with a client who are doing a Risk assessment of payment transactions and this role is around upgrading their current platform, it is on some VM's (virtual machines) and needs upgrading versions.

Description:
Description

About Auror

At Auror, we’re empowering the retail industry to reduce theft and Organized Retail Crime, a $150 billion problem globally. It’s high volume crime that’s increasingly organized in nature and is putting people, retailers, and communities at risk every day.

Founded in New Zealand, we’re working with some of the best and largest retailers in the world across Australasia, North America, and the UK.

Auror connects people with intelligence to reduce crime. As a company, we’ve built a high-performing, positive culture with a focus on providing an inclusive environment for a diverse team. If you’re excited about reducing crime and building safer communities, for everyone, then we want you on our team.

The Role

Taking the lessons learned from our customers, the police and the industry overall, we built a new, easy-to-use, high performing, and scalable platform to take Auror to the rest of the world. We’re now building on this foundation and have big plans for the future.

As a company we’re all actively collaborating to make our product exceptional and we’re looking for someone to come in and work with our product, UX, design, engineering, and QA teams to evolve the Auror platform to better meet the needs of our current and future customers.

We’re a growing company so in this role you can expect your day to day to include;

Working with customers and users to ensure we understand the problems they’re facing, and sharing that context with the work stream/s you look after
Exploring and experimenting to maximise the impact the work we do has on solving customer problems
Diving into the detail of the work the work stream/s you support are doing all the way from discovery to delivery and post-release analysis
Working with other Product Managers, Designers, Software Engineers, and QA, to clearly define epics / features / user stories
Collaborating with key partners to manage roadmaps for the workstream/s you look after that support our wider company goals
Being a key driver and motivating the work stream teams you look after to ship value frequently
Measuring impact of changes made once in the hands of users, and iterating to maximise value

In your first 90 days you’ll be tasked with developing a thorough understanding of the market we work in, and getting a good big picture of where we’re heading. You’ll need to have a clear view of the problems to be solved, and the current scope, but also a good understanding of the things that are still unknown. There will be lots of finer details to dig into so you will be spending time researching and refining.

This role reports to Heather Legg, Director of Product

I stumbled into Product after 5 years in market research, user research roles and analytics. I quickly found Product Management to be the happy place in my venn diagram; an overlapping of being able to learn deeply about other people and their lives, with the creative juice and excitement of being able to create awesome things. This drive to understand and create is a pattern I see in many things that energise me; at home it's being channelled through my dog Emmie, who I'm adamant about training into a super-dog. In my hobbies it comes through in my love of discovering and creating new and interesting foods. At work it comes through in a passion to make products that solve real problems in a way that sparks excitement in our users.As a general rule I am most animated when I'm problem solving surrounded by kind and ambitious people, and what better place to do it that than at Auror. We have a team of superstars who are empowering retailers and Police globally to stop crime, for good. You can check out my LinkedIn here.

Requirements

To ace this role you will;

Have a highly collaborative approach and enjoy mentoring other members of the team
Be deeply curious about the wider Auror experience and how it fits into the loss prevention landscape
Have experience using data to drive areas of improvement and product strategy
Be customer obsessed and can effectively define the discovery we need across a range of product areas to answer questions that will help us solve the right problems at the right time
Be familiar with working with software development teams and running SaaS projects;
Be comfortable talking to customers and stakeholders;
Have an ability to see the problem to be solved without immediately jumping to a solution, and to share context with the team so that all possible approaches can be surfaced;
Be pragmatic, with an understanding and appreciation for working in an ever changing environment;
Have exceptional organisational and analytical skills, along with attention to detail.
Have excellent written and verbal communication skills

We are looking for people who demonstrate a strong alignment to our Guiding Principles (you can find these on our Careers page).

With diversity and inclusion at the forefront of Aurors guiding principles, we promote a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusiveness at Auror, regardless of, but not limited to, race, gender, sexual orientation, family status, religion, ethnicity, national origin, physical disability, veteran status, or age.

Benefits
You’ll own part of a company making a real difference!
We are hard-working and outcome focused, but recognize there is more to life than work. We promote a healthy work/life blend.
Everyone gets Friday afternoon’s off, so you can start your weekend early, and do more of whatever it is that makes you happy.
We understand how vital both mental and physical health is, and have policies to support that, including Wellness Days (days that you can take for any reason whatsoever, not just for when you’re sick/ unwell).
We offer comprehensive parental leave and benefits for primary and non-primary caregivers.
We support our team to participate in courses, conferences, or events that will help them be relentless about improvement.
We have regular team lunches and social events where most (if not all) activities are during work hours.
You’ll work to solve interesting problems and help us keep communities safe.


If you’re excited about our mission and you have experience and a passion for this role

We’re proud that Auror is a place where everyone can learn and grow. So if you’re not sure that you tick all the boxes but feel you’re close to what we’re looking for, please apply anyway as we’d love to hear from you! Once you apply, you’ll hear from us to acknowledge your application. If you have questions about any of the above, or if you have any accessibility requirements, we’ll be able to help you from there.

Description:
The Role
Here at Fisher & Paykel Appliances, we design with people in mind and the lives lived around our products. We aim to create moments of delight together in the heart of the home, sustainably enhancing the quality of people's lives, now and for future generations. This purpose is the very heart of why we exist, it's our reason for being here.
We are driven by our values of being trusted, sustainably minded, innovative, generous, and curious. As a team, we take a collaborative approach and have a working environment where all ideas are heard, evaluated, and tested against our leading goal - to be the world's most human centered appliance brand.
This is where you come in…
Our Dishwashing team based in Dunedin has an ongoing and exciting programme of work. If you are a mechanical engineer with some good product design experience under your belt, we want to hear from you.
You should enjoy working as an integral member of multidisciplinary engineering projects. Our PD engineers work from early-stage product concept generation right through to implementation and serial production applying Learning First Product Development methodology. Responsible for driving collaborative work with all branches of the business to achieve your objectives (e.g. electronic, software, procurement and Simultaneous engineering teams), you will be hands-on and can demonstrate ability in practical test setups, capturing data and performing your own analysis, and modelling and simulation of subsystem behaviours to drive key decisions around component design or selection. You thrive in an environment where you can own the results of your hard work and be involved in managing your contribution through the entire Product Development process.

Description:
The Company
A better understanding of the Earth creates a better world for all. Seequent brings together industry-leading earth modelling, geo-data management, and team collaboration software.

Because when everyone can see the full picture, they can make better decisions that benefit people and the planet.

Every day, our customers in over 100 countries work to develop vital mineral resources more sustainably, design and build better infrastructure, protect the environment, source renewable energy, and help resolve historical challenges such as groundwater contamination and ageing infrastructure.

We’re here to help them. That why we’re constantly evolving at the forefront of technology and geoscience – from Cloud accessibility, to 3D modelling, to digital collaboration.

Headquartered in New Zealand with our team located in 25 locations around the world, Seequent is a high growth, people-centric success story. We’re passionate, curious, Earth lovers.

Ready to help change the world? Join us.

Description:
This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Python engineer who is passionate about open source software, Linux, and cloud-native computing. This is a role for individual contribution through high quality, Pythonic code. We're looking for evidence of technical leadership, exceptional design and intuitive documentation.
You'll be responsible for designing and maintaining a Python framework and surrounding tools that enable the creation and management of Charmed Operators - software that drives software.
You'll be designing and implementing the foundation for software operators that can run anywhere, from bare metal to Kubernetes in the cloud. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure the framework provides a reliable, easy-to-use solution that scales to production workloads and meets the needs of our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology.

Description:
Rocket Lab
Rocket Lab is a vertically integrated provider of small launch services, satellites, and spacecraft components. Our mission is to open access to space to improve life on Earth. Our team is over 1,300 people strong and we're adding to it every week. Collaboration is at our core – every idea is heard, and everyone makes a difference. Teams are nimble, decisions are made quickly, and we are action oriented.

About the role
Rocket Lab operates maintains several three engine test facilities across facilities in the Auckland and Waikato regions for Rutherford engine testing.. The engine test cells within these facilities require maintenance and support, as well as continuous improvement to the software tooling to assist Test Engineers complete engine testing faster and more efficiently.

The Test Support Engineer will be involved in all aspects of the engine test cell and test rig setup s and maintenance, including from configuration, initial setup, continuous improvement, and support for the operators running the test. They will also be involved in setup, maintenance and improvement of engine test data analysis tools (Tableau), databases (SQL and Postgres) as well as test automation tools such as National Instruments Teststand.

The position will require learning a broad range of knowledge across software systems, as well as an understanding of the electrical, and mechanical and fluid systems the software controls, to assist our engineers be fiercely efficient.

Description:
New Zealand Police is working with the community to make New Zealanders be safe and feel safe. With over 13,000 staff, we provide policing services 24 hours a day, every day. We operate by land, sea and air, manage over 860,000 emergency calls a year and are always actively preventing crime and crashes.

We’re working towards specific goals and targets that highlight our intent to work collaboratively with iwi and communities, other government sectors and business partners to deliver ‘Our Business’ and achieve long-term change.

Technical Security Engineer, it starts with you!
Based at Wellington * Permanent, Full Time * Police Employee – Authorised Officer * JR4493179 * Nationally Advertised Vacancy
About the role

Do you love data? Want to do work for good? We are looking for a motivated and talented Data Analyst / Engineer to build and drive our Elastic Stack based analytics capability. This is a role you can mould and make your own.

You’ll have an inquisitive mind and enjoy working through the details of problem and be able to turn your hand to nearly any problem that’s presented to you.

You will have exceptional project management skills, the ability to prioritise conflicting tasks effectively, and proven analytical/problem solving skills.

In this role, you will be able to demonstrate the following technical requirements:


What you’ll bring

Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your state of mind, the alignment of your values with ours, your ability to contribute to and build high performing teams, and the way that you lead yourself or others.


You will have a willingness to roll up your sleeves and get involved whatever is needed. This is an operationally focussed group so you will need to be able switch priorities and focus quickly.

To be eligible for this role you must have been a NZ citizen for at least 10 years. Alternatively, you must hold NZ Permanent Residence/a current NZ Residency Class Visa and have been a citizen of UK, USA, Canada or Australia for at least 10 years.

You must be able to obtain and maintain a high level of security clearance. Ordinarily to obtain this level of clearance candidates must have a 10-year checkable background in countries where meaningful and reliable checks can be undertaken. Where requisite checks are unable to be made, the candidate application may not be able to be progressed.

If you are an internal applicant, you must apply internally through the police system. You must provide an alternative contact email address.

This role is set at Individual Contributor level, this means your key purpose is “to deliver or enable others to deliver Our Business”.

We will ask you questions based on “How we will deliver Our Business – Core Competencies” and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor. For more information on Our Core Competencies, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/core-competencies-how-we-will-deliver-our-business.pdf

These questions will be unique and specific to the role, focusing on the aspects the hiring manager believes are most important for that position at the time. For more information on Our Values, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/nzp-our-values.pdf

To view the position description for this role please copy and paste this link into a new browser:

https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/pd/05-2022/technical_security_engineer.pdf

About us

Our mission is to prevent crime and harm through exceptional policing. Our vision is to be the safest country. Our purpose is to ensure everybody can be safe and feel safe.

Working Flexibly

Your wellbeing inside and outside of work is important to us. We’re open to discussing flexible working options that work for both you and the business.

For more information on the above, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers

How to apply
Applications submitted directly through the Government Jobs Website are no longer considered. Please visit our Police Careers page: https://career10.successfactors.com/career?company=nzpolice to apply for this position.

If this position sounds like you, click apply now. You will be required to submit an application form and a CV. Before confirmation of hire, pre-employment checks will be undertaken.

For further information on the application process, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers

Remuneration upon appointment to the role will be (starting) $87,401 - $105,259

If you have any questions about this vacancy, please contact Tayla-paige.clingan@police.govt.nz

Applications close at 5pm on Thursday 20th April 2023.

Description:
Company Description
Our story
Partly's mission is to connect the world's parts and we're doing that by building the first global platform for replacement parts, starting with auto parts. Our big vision is to accelerate the world towards a sustainable future where waste is eliminated and all replacement parts are universally searchable, accessible and available to all.
We've more than tripled our team over the last 12 months and expect to double in size again over the coming 12 months. We're a global team spanning both Europe and Australasia. Founded by ex-Rocket Lab engineers, we utilise bleeding-edge technology to solve challenging but exciting problems that make a huge impact in a $1.9 trillion industry.
We provide a scalable digital infrastructure solution to some of the world's largest businesses and the most exciting startups. Partly's solutions are integrated across hundreds of companies globally, providing the backbone for cataloguing and managing parts online.

Can you create great software solutions?
Do you enjoy an environment that promotes innovative solutions to support intelligence investigations?
Would you like the freedom to try new things? This might be the right place for you…..
The Organisation:
The New Zealand Security Intelligence Service (NZSIS) is looking for an experienced and highly competent Software Engineer with the necessary ‘tight-lipped’ skills to get amongst enhancing Aotearoa’s national security.
You will work for a national organisation with diverse, talented, and committed individuals who are anything but ordinary – creating a better and safer environment for all New Zealanders. With exciting growth opportunities within the community, and where curiosity and inquisitive minds are encouraged, the work you do with the NZSIS will be like nothing you have ever done before.

This next step could shape your career forever.


This is an outstanding opportunity to develop your world class Software Engineering skillset in a unique environment.

You will work within a team of creative software developers who work on core internal applications.

The position will focus on:

Do you really know your stuff? Are your development skills top-notch and able to create elegant, efficient, secure solutions?

New Zealand Police is working with the community to make New Zealanders be safe and feel safe. With over 13,000 staff, we provide policing services 24 hours a day, every day. Senior Infrastructure Development Engineer, it starts with you!
Based at Royal New Zealand Police College, Porirua, Wellington * Permanent/Full Time * Police Employee * JR 4493580
About the role

Do you have a passion for technology and thrive on challenges? We're looking for a talented Infrastructure Development Engineer specialising in Linux and Middleware to join our dynamic team at the NZ Police Information and Communications Technology Service Centre, based at the Royal New Zealand Police College, Porirua.

The Police ICT Service Centre is here to save police officers time, enhance their safety and contribute to making New Zealand a safer community. To prevent crime and crashes, Police needs information delivered to the front line that is reliable and able to be accessed anywhere, anytime. Making this happen is the daily work of our people in the ICT Service Centre. With our operational colleagues and partners, we create world leading solutions in mobile, computer aided dispatch, intelligence, networks, and security. We are looking for people that have the technical expertise but most importantly share our vision for innovation, partnerships and being part of a positive work environment.

This role is responsible for providing expertise and guidance on technology architectures, develop detailed solution designs and specifications to support the optimal operation of the Police ICT infrastructure ensuring it is sufficiently robust, scalable and efficient and meets technical and security standards and requirements.

You will have high levels of motivation and have experience working as part of a team as a Senior Infrastructure Development Engineer. In doing so you will have developed your engagement skills at all levels of organisations and be able to build networks and trust.

This is a dynamic and challenging position, and the successful applicant will need to be able to demonstrate the following.

Description:
NTT is a leading global IT solutions and services organisation that brings together people, data and things to create a better and more sustainable future.
In today’s ‘iNTTerconnected’ world, connections matter more now than ever. By bringing together talented people, world-class technology partners and emerging innovators, we help our clients solve some of the world’s most significant technological, business and societal challenges.
With people at the heart of our success, NTT is committed to attracting and growing the best talent and providing an environment where everyone feels they can belong and their contribution matters.

Want to be a part of our team?
The NTT Managed Services Team is a dynamic and high performing team supporting NTT’s client in a Managed / Outsourced Environment.

Your role is to perform a variety of 3rd level engineering activities to enable the delivery of complete Integrated Services Management across all ITIL disciplines, being Service Desk, Incident Management, Problem Management, Configuration Management, Change Management and Release Management.
This includes applying your analytical, reasoning & specialized technical expertise to investigate, isolate and rectify network incidents, identify the root cause and undertake problem management activities. You will also be required to use these same skills to implement complex, large scale network changes within a structured change management framework, to perform release management and configuration management tasks in line with an ITIL compliant operations delivery structure.
To do this you will need to acquire a solid understanding of the NTT’s Integrated Services Management Operation “end-to-end”, to gain a thorough understanding of the customer’s specific business operations and how these apply to each of the specific ITIL disciplines. It is this specific customer knowledge that will assist you to fulfil your duties and ensure you are an effective and autonomous member of the team.
You will need to demonstrate a high level of commitment, initiative, and ability in your work. You should be a motivated self-starter with proven abilities to get the job done. You should possess excellent communication skills, a strong IT background and be able to use these skills to deliver services within the ITIL driven Integrated Services Management environment.
You will be required to participate in the provision of on-call functions on a rotational basis. You will also be required to perform network changes outside of normal business hours within time frames that are specified to reduce disruption to the customers business.

Description:
New Zealand Police is working with the community to make New Zealanders be safe and feel safe. With over 13,000 staff, we provide policing services 24 hours a day, every day. We operate by land, sea and air, manage over 860,000 emergency calls a year and are always actively preventing crime and crashes.

We’re working towards specific goals and targets that highlight our intent to work collaboratively with iwi and communities, other government sectors and business partners to deliver ‘Our Business’ and achieve long-term change.

Senior Infrastructure Development Engineer, it starts with you!
Based at Royal New Zealand Police College, Porirua, Wellington * Permanent/Full Time * Police Employee * JR 4493580
About the role

Do you have a passion for technology and thrive on challenges? We're looking for a talented Infrastructure Development Engineer specialising in Linux and Middleware to join our dynamic team at the NZ Police Information and Communications Technology Service Centre, based at the Royal New Zealand Police College, Porirua.

The Police ICT Service Centre is here to save police officers time, enhance their safety and contribute to making New Zealand a safer community. To prevent crime and crashes, Police needs information delivered to the front line that is reliable and able to be accessed anywhere, anytime. Making this happen is the daily work of our people in the ICT Service Centre. With our operational colleagues and partners, we create world leading solutions in mobile, computer aided dispatch, intelligence, networks, and security. We are looking for people that have the technical expertise but most importantly share our vision for innovation, partnerships and being part of a positive work environment.

This role is responsible for providing expertise and guidance on technology architectures, develop detailed solution designs and specifications to support the optimal operation of the Police ICT infrastructure ensuring it is sufficiently robust, scalable and efficient and meets technical and security standards and requirements.

You will have high levels of motivation and have experience working as part of a team as a Senior Infrastructure Development Engineer. In doing so you will have developed your engagement skills at all levels of organisations and be able to build networks and trust.

This is a dynamic and challenging position, and the successful applicant will need to be able to demonstrate the following.


What you’ll bring

Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your state of mind, the alignment of your values with ours, your ability to contribute to and build high performing teams, and the way that you lead yourself or others.

You will bring
If you are an internal applicant, you must apply internally through the police system. You must provide an alternative contact email address.

This role is set at Individual Contributor level, this means your key purpose is “to deliver or enable others to deliver Our Business”.

We will ask you questions based on “How we will deliver Our Business – Core Competencies” and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor. For more information on Our Core Competencies, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/core-competencies-how-we-will-deliver-our-business.pdf

These questions will be unique and specific to the role, focusing on the aspects the hiring manager believes are most important for that position at the time. For more information on Our Values, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/nzp-our-values.pdf

To view the position description for this role please copy and paste this link into a new browser:
https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/pd/04-2023/senior_infrastructure_development_engineer_1.pdf

About us

Our mission is to prevent crime and harm through exceptional policing. Our vision is to be the safest country. Our purpose is to ensure everybody can be safe and feel safe.

Working Flexibly

Your wellbeing inside and outside of work is important to us. We’re open to discussing flexible working options that work for both you and the business.

For more information on the above, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers

How to apply

If this position sounds like you, click apply now. You will be required to submit an application form and a CV. Before confirmation of hire, pre-employment checks will be undertaken.

For further information on the application process, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers

Remuneration upon appointment to the role will be (starting) $102,178 - $119,074 (midpoint)

If you have any questions about this vacancy, please contact deepa.shankar@police.govt.nz

Applications close Monday 24th April 2023.

Technical Security Engineer, it starts with you!
Based at Wellington * Permanent, Full Time * Police Employee – Authorised Officer * JR4493179 * Nationally Advertised Vacancy
About the role

Do you love data? Want to do work for good? We are looking for a motivated and talented Data Analyst / Engineer to build and drive our Elastic Stack based analytics capability. This is a role you can mould and make your own.

You’ll have an inquisitive mind and enjoy working through the details of problem and be able to turn your hand to nearly any problem that’s presented to you.

You will have exceptional project management skills, the ability to prioritise conflicting tasks effectively, and proven analytical/problem solving skills.

In this role, you will be able to demonstrate the following technical requirements:


What you’ll bring

Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your state of mind, the alignment of your values with ours, your ability to contribute to and build high performing teams, and the way that you lead yourself or others.


You will have a willingness to roll up your sleeves and get involved whatever is needed. This is an operationally focussed group so you will need to be able switch priorities and focus quickly.

To be eligible for this role you must have been a NZ citizen for at least 10 years. Alternatively, you must hold NZ Permanent Residence/a current NZ Residency Class Visa and have been a citizen of UK, USA, Canada or Australia for at least 10 years.

You must be able to obtain and maintain a high level of security clearance. Ordinarily to obtain this level of clearance candidates must have a 10-year checkable background in countries where meaningful and reliable checks can be undertaken. Where requisite checks are unable to be made, the candidate application may not be able to be progressed.

If you are an internal applicant, you must apply internally through the police system. You must provide an alternative contact email address.

Description:
Are you passionate about providing safe drinking water to customers and providing sustainable solutions to meet growth?
Flexible working arrangements
Full-time, permanent position based in Petone
This is a full time position of 40 hours per week

As Principal Engineer you will take a guiding role on network projects, supporting the Network Engineering team to deliver them and lending your technical expertise to complex issues. You will review work and provide technical guidance across the business and to the wider industry at a regional and national level.

Description:
About the Team

Join a pioneer regional team in a globally established company that is continually redefining how people travel. Our APAC team is responsible for reliably connecting our customers with diversified sources of travel inventory (Air, Hotel, Ground transportation) so that we can always offer the best possible deal. As Senior Software Engineer, you will be responsible for representing the Asia-Pacific travel customer by scaling and improving our feature set and operations.

You’ll work with a highly skilled team of technical, data and product-focused individuals, whose mission is to consistently find and deliver the best travel deals for our customers. Everything we do is focused on customer experience, data measurement and delivering value at speed, helping Hopper rise to the top of the travel industry - you’ll be responsible for making that a reality.

We aim to measurably change how legal work is done & improve access to justice. At the core of achieving this is our people and giving them the tools and support to succeed.
We are a global organization and team, spanning across the US, Europe, India and New Zealand, delivering value to Fortune 500 clients, such as Lenovo and Wesfarmers.

Description:
Why Invenco?

Here are our top three reasons for why you want to join Invenco:
Culture: Down-to-earth, open culture that values diversity & inclusivity.
Products: We’re building new & unique products for the payments industry – if you are a techie this is the place to be.
Global: We’re a global company – opportunity for travel, being part of a diverse team and international secondments as well.
Invenco – Work Environment


Invenco uniquely builds highly complex end-to-end payment solutions. We have teams based in New Zealand, Malaysia and North America – focused on creating new and revolutionary products. We have all tech stacks including hardware, embedded applications, software & cloud. Our values of winning, collaboration & innovation are core to our culture – and we focus on continuing to build a positive environment. There has never been a better time to join us.

Description:
Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here.
Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.
Who We Are…
When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what’s next…
From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.


Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you need a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.

Job_title: Express of Interest - Junior Blockchain Developer
Description:
About OnFinality & SubQuery
OnFinality is an organisation dedicated to providing key infrastructure services to the Blockchain community. OnFinality, and its child projects SubQuery and Aoraki, is a small but growing organisation based in Auckland providing services to the world.
OnFinality’s aim is to support growing teams with infrastructure and API services. We provide easy to use infrastructure automation tools to reduce the amount of time development teams need to spend managing and deploying infrastructure. We also provide free mission-critical public services to various networks via our API service (providing over 50 million API requests each day).
SubQuery is all about making the world’s decentralised data more accessible. Every team needs to process and query decentralised data - historically this data is in a format that makes it difficult to read. We transform and save this data to make it easier and faster to allow it to be used in more complex applications.

Description:
DATANOMIQ ist der erste deutsche Anbieter für Beratung und Dienstleistungen, der Data Analytics ganzheitlich versteht und anbietet. Von klassischer Business Intelligence über Process Mining bis hin zu Data Science und Deep Learning bestreiten wir die Daten(r)evolution aus allen Perspektiven. Wir sind eine innovative und ambitionierte Company mit datenbegeisterten Kollegen. Was uns täglich antreibt ist es, herausragende Lösungen für anspruchsvolle, datenbasierte Probleme zu entwickeln. Bei DATANOMIQ erleben wir das Morgen schon heute. Vielleicht bald mit Dir.

Aufgrund unseres angestrebten Wachstums sowie der kontinuierlichen Erweiterung unseres Lösungs- und Service-Portfolios suchen wir nach motivierten und engagierten Talenten für unsere junge, erfolgreiche Mannschaft. Werde Teil eines sympathischen und zum permanenten Lernen bereiten Teams durch deinen Einstieg als unseren Team Lead für Data Engineers, Data Analysts und/oder Data Scientists.

About Us
Are you looking for an opportunity to make a real difference in your next role?
At Osho, our purpose is to radically accelerate the clean-energy revolution - starting with smarter, safer, and more efficient homes. We’re focused on improving experiences for people through the application of technology, data, and a deep understanding of human behaviour.
Why? As a society, we must decarbonise and accelerate the transition to alternative energy sources. Existing solutions are expensive and disparate, with limited functionality.
Osho is driven by purpose, real innovation, and ambition. We have a talented team across New Zealand, with a creative space by the beach in Takapuna and a Design Lab in Christchurch where our physical products come to life.

Mangere HVAC Company - Work on innovative products with a high performing team
Research & Development - Collaborate on interesting projects & drive progress
Fantastic career opportunity with long-term prospects & great remuneration.
Senior Embedded Systems Engineer - Work with cutting edge HVAC products for local and international markets.
About Company:
International Mangere based company that is a leading manufacturer, distributor and exporter of innovative Air Conditioning and Ventilation products. They are leading the way in HVAC design and innovation, dedicated to innovating solutions to reduce the environmental impact of air conditioning.



SnrSystEng - AC - April 2023

We’re a small team of engineers looking after a lot of infrastructure. We monitor, improve, install and manage the infrastructure that supports over 2000 crew and the delivery of world leading visual effects. We support thousands of servers, petabytes of storage, a diverse network setup, and have interesting security requirements to meet. Behind our crew and the films we work on, is the architecture built by the infrastructure team. We’re always on call to keep our systems up and running, ensuring we deliver on time and that our crew have the best experience possible.
To complement the skillset in our team, we are looking for an Infrastructure Engineer with hands-on experience in Linux and desire to learn Storage technologies. Our Infrastructure Engineers perform both day-to-day support and project work to sustain and improve our large, primarily cross-platform infrastructure.
As the successful candidate you will:

Description:
Join the team redefining how the world experiences design.

Hey, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora,你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point.


Where and how you can work
Our flagship campus is in Sydney, Australia but in Aotearoa, we have a hub in Auckland that we call home to our local operations. And with that, you have choice in how and where you work. That means if you want to do your thing at our Auckland hub (if you're nearby) or at home or a bit of both, it's up to you.

Description:
Join an award-winning consulting practice with global reach and thought leadership.
Be part of a high-performing team and expand your experience and capabilities.
We support flexible working and believe it is critical to increasing engagement, optimising resources, supporting work-life balance and employee wellbeing.
The Opportunity
The future of IT is becoming more data-driven, mobile, distributed and connected, creating exciting challenges for solution architects to match the pace of new technology. You will work with the latest methodologies and emerging technologies to deliver cloud-native solutions, leveraging serverless and micro-services platforms, setting a new standard in place of traditional architecture, delivering continuous drives for business innovation, and changing the way we view technology. We love to solve challenging problems and embrace cloud-native bleeding-edge technologies to build highly optimised and automated solutions to help our customers overcome complexity. Be more agile in experimenting, testing, and fail fast to explore ways to deliver business outcomes.

Description:
Aderant, is a software house providing business management software for legal firms. Our talented and enthusiastic staff mean that we have become a trusted partner to firms of all sizes, from boutique firms based in one office, to global organizations spanning four continents. While our legacy has been providing on-premises software, we’re also embracing the opportunities presented by cloud services and taking advantage of them.
This isn’t just another job; it’s about building your career and working together to support your aspiration of becoming a real IT professional. Candidates with debtors, creditors and accounting experience welcome to apply
As an Application Support Specialist based in our Albany office you will be providing exceptional customer service to our clients in the Asia/Pacific region by providing application support for our practice management time and billing system, and answering questions on the business function and usage of our product via telephone, and or internet. This dynamic role addresses, documents, and resolves client issues while adhering to service level agreements to move the product forward.

Description:
Te Tākinatanga - Our Story
At Toitū Te Whenua Land Information New Zealand, our key role is to ensure New Zealanders have accurate information about where people and places are, that people have confidence in their property rights and that Crown property is well managed for future generations.
From the best way to develop farmland, build a new suburb, manage a high-country farm or navigate on land or at sea, our work and location information help people make better decisions and create economic, social, environmental and cultural value for New Zealand.
Kōrero mō te tūranga - About the role
You are a rock star cloud engineer specialising in AWS and have AWS Professional and Specialty certifications under your belt. You are passionate about AWS and want to evangelise about it both within Toitū Te Whenua and within other AWS communities in New Zealand and the public sector.
You will be designing, building, operating and securing the common infrastructure used by our DevOps teams to launch their products on AWS to the world. You will also be negotiating work with vendors who deliver products or services on our AWS platform and monitoring their performance and delivery.
You will be an AWS guru within Toitū Te Whenua and the DevOps teams will look towards you and your team for AWS expertise and guidance. You will drive the AWS Community of Practice (CoP) within Toitū Te Whenua and will represent Toitū Te Whenua and New Zealand in various external AWS communities. You will be the point of contact for Toitū Te Whenua for the AWS account team, Technical Account Manager and Solution Architects.
$112,849-$152,677.


Toitū Te Whenua offers an environment with lots of opportunities to be involved in challenging and highly visible technical work that impacts positively on New Zealand's future. Our Digital Delivery group is taking on exciting revolutionary projects including a rebuild of a System of National Importance which will run on the AWS platform.
We embrace diversity, have a strong focus on personal development, and offer flexible working arrangements to ensure our people have a work-life balance. We have an active social club, a branch of Toastmasters that meets onsite and a collaborative team culture.
Toitū Te Whenua is highly active in the AWS community in Wellington with representation on both the committee of the AWS Users Group New Zealand and the AWS Public Sector Cloud Alliance for Australia and New Zealand and we expect you to continue this tradition.
Tono mai - How to Apply
To apply, please click “Apply Online.” You'll be taken through to our Toitū Te Whenua Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description. You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV/Cover Letter.
Applications close-14th April 23
If you have any questions about this role or working at Toitū Te Whenua, please email opportunities@linz.govt.nz and our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.
Following a Health & Safety Risk Assessment undertaken by Toitū Te Whenua, it will be a requirement of this position to hold a valid “My Vaccine Pass” from your agreed starting date with Toitū Te Whenua. Please only apply for this position if you are able to or intend on meeting this requirement.
“My Vaccine Pass” is an official record of your COVID-19 vaccination status for use in Aotearoa New Zealand. For more information: My Vaccine Pass | Unite against COVID-19 (covid19.govt.nz)
As an organisation Toitū Te Whenua embraces diversity, encourages work life balance and we have a flexible approach to the way we work which means you will quickly feel connected and valued.

Description:
The role of a Silicon Alliances Business Development Lead at Canonical
Ubuntu is the fastest growing enterprise Linux, the leading platform for public cloud computing, and the engineer's favorite way to drive the future.
Our goal is to help the enterprise embrace open source from end to end, across every class of compute and every class of application, starting with the linux kernel itself, to infrastructure solutions like OpenStack and Kubernetes, all the way up to data, security, analytics and serverless capabilities.
The Silicon Alliances Team works with the leading semiconductor companies to combine open source adoption with innovative optimizations to get the most from each new chip. With our semiconductor partners, we develop joint product roadmaps, drive delivery, formulate go-to-market plans and conceptualize new business models, enabling differentiated hardware and robust product life-cycle support while still anchored to best-in-class Ubuntu. The end goal is a frictionless experience to deploy, maintain, and develop on any hardware from cloud to edge.

Description:
The Company
This is an established company in Auckland that design and deliver automated production machinery and product handling and tracking systems in the food production and warehousing/distribution sectors mainly but also with a local machine building OEM and a service provider too.
The Role
We are looking for an Automation Engineer at the intermediate level (e.g., 3 to 5 years’ experience) to design, program, and commission industrial automation projects and do maintenance and troubleshooting with existing clients.
The company are quite happy to train someone, but you will need to be able to program PLC code from scratch as a base level requirement, not just maintain it, and ideally already be familiar with Rockwell / Allen Bradley and/or Beckhoff PLC’s coding in Ladder Logic and/or Structured Text.

About the role
The Cloud Engineer is focused on working with the leading-edge cloud capabilities, modern delivery practices, and delivering serverless outcomes.
We are looking for professionals with a real passion for pushing the boundaries, improving operations, and driving continuous improvement.
As part of our Cloud Integration Team, our Cloud Engineers are delivering modern integration expertise in serverless development, operations, and innovation.
As a Cloud Engineer, you’ll lead developing, implementing, and supporting industry leading solutions leveraging Azure and AWS serverless technologies.
Whilst solving customers business challenges, you’ll also provide enablement not only in the technology but also in modern ways of working like DevOps.
This a flexible and varied role working with a diverse range of customers across the cloud transformation spectrum to:

Description:
This organization and leadership team will support and encourage you to grow and develop this role as your skills and knowledge quickly comes up to speed. It is an exciting and challenging role in that you have the opportunity to work across the entire lifecycle of a product, both technically and commercially.

The Organization
Victor Hydraulics is a Christchurch, New Zealand based global leader in the design and manufacture of steel, stainless steel and aluminum hydraulic cylinders. Victor is recognized as a leader in their field thanks to a culture of on-going innovation and improvement focused on the needs of their customers and internal teamwork. Victor has developed an international reputation for designing and manufacturing specialist hydraulic cylinders to a wide range of customers including global OEM's.

EHS Support is a Global Leader in Environmental, Health, and Safety Solutions. Our global family of engineers, geologists, scientists, and technical experts specialise in providing customised, long-term solutions for complex environmental, health, and safety (EH&S) challenges across a wide array of industries.
EHS Support was born of a vision to create an innovative place to work with a philosophy of doing things better. Here, we treat our employees with respect and help them grow and thrive in their careers. We provide higher quality and more innovative technical solutions for projects. We also provide our clients with a greater level of service than they have grown to expect with other consultants. Bottom line — we get the job done.
EHS Support is seeking an experienced and highly resourceful Project Coordinator (remote) to provide end-to-end administrative project and deliverable support to our New Zealand Team. The successful candidate will be an organised, self-starter, proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, Teams, and PowerPoint) with a strong grasp of project tracking, team coordination, and document production. Our future team member is a detail oriented multi-tasker with the determination and drive to ensure excellence throughout the project lifecycle, from project initiation (proposals, contracts, insurance) through to completion (document delivery, invoices). Ideally our candidate will also have some familiarity with or be willing to learn and take ownership of contract administration, including work orders, subcontractor requirements, proposals, and terms and conditions.

– Very Minimal Travel, local clients
The Company
Our Auckland based client is a well-established Industrial Control Systems Integrator in New Zealand. They are a tight knit team who work on design, install, and service projects that are primarily in or near Auckland. You will get to work on automation systems across a wide range of different industries and interesting projects, a great place to learn and remain at the pointy end of being a technically savvy systems integrator at the intersection of industrial automation, systems integration, and database / MES type work.
Due to continuing growth in the Auckland region this company need another experienced Systems Integrator to work with their well-known and reputable clients.

We are looking for an exceptional Propulsion Analyst with a practical, can-do attitude to join our in-space propulsion team. In this role, you will be primarily responsible for the analysis by simulation and optimisation of propulsion systems for satellites.
You will see your work go from initial design, all the way to space.
We move fast, provide exceptional customer experiences, deliver what we say we will, and love to change industry norms. Join us.

Description:
UneeQ is an artificial intelligence company, developing the most advanced autonomous digital human platform available for customer interactions – today and in tomorrow’s metaverse.
Our mission is to deliver digital human experiences that excel in marketing, sales and service roles – reducing complexity, improving conversions and creating memorable customer moments for brands.
UneeQ was born out of a program to provide disabled people better access to information. We quickly realized digital humans are able to help people with many other perennially tricky problems – from financial literacy to healthcare coaching and simplifying complex customer journeys. We found the pitfalls, the limitations and the areas of real value and opportunity.

Description:
About Scion
Scion is a Crown Research Institute dedicated to using science and technology to develop innovative solutions to the world's most pressing challenges. With two main campuses in Rotorua and Christchurch, our work spans a wide range of sectors, including forestry, wood products, wood-derived materials, and other biomaterials. We are at the forefront of innovative technology development for standing forests, renewables, bioproducts, energy, and the establishment of a broader based bioeconomy. More than 300 scientists, engineers, researchers, and support staff, who are passionate about pushing the boundaries of what is possible to create a better future for people and the planet. At Scion, we believe in collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning, with the chance to work on or lead cutting-edge research projects with other experts in the field.
The Role

About Us
Are you looking for an opportunity to make a real difference in your next role?
At Osho, our purpose is to radically accelerate the clean-energy revolution - starting with smarter, safer, and more efficient homes. We’re focused on improving experiences for people through the application of technology, data, and a deep understanding of human behaviour.
Why? As a society, we need to decarbonise and accelerate the transition to alternative energy sources. Existing solutions are expensive and disparate, with limited functionality.
Osho is driven by purpose, real innovation, and ambition. We have a talented team spread across New Zealand, with a creative space by the beach in Takapuna, and a Design Lab in Christchurch where our physical products come to life. We're more than happy to take on someone who wants to work remotely from a different location across New Zealand too, or wants to relocate.

Job_title: Kaiwhakahaere Horanga Hangarau | Manager – Technology Delivery
Description:
Kaiwhakahaere Horanga Hangarau | Manager - Technology Delivery
Join an organisation contributing to meaningful outcomes, About Aotearoa, for Aotearoa - data that improves lives today and for generations to come.

New role, make it your own, set the standardand build your team
Showcase your skills in a business that values coaching and mentoring
Work in our brand new 6-star green building, or work flexibly
Mōu | For you
Tatauranga Aotearoa Stats NZ are dedicated to diversity, equity, inclusion, health, and wellbeing. We welcome every gender, ethnicity, ability, religion, age, and background and encourage people to be their authentic selves.
Starting salary: By negotiation + superannuation

Te tūnga | The role
We have an exciting opportunity for a passionate and highly skilled individual to join our team as a Technology Delivery Manager in Technology Services - Corporate Technology. We need to increase our capacity in this area and in this role, you will be responsible for recruiting and building a new team of system engineers to work alongside the existing delivery team. In your role as Technology Delivery Manager, you will report to the Senior Manager - Corporate Technology within the Technology Services branch.
You will be responsible for the facilitation, management, prioritisation, estimation and work allocation for a multi-disciplinary technology delivery team which deliver a range of digital services. Corporate Technology is responsible for the key corporate resources that all Stats NZ staff use e.g. MS365, Exchange Online, Azure, SharePoint, as well as a range of Cloud based services.
Requirements in your role may change with the needs of the organisation but you will be expected to play a key part in evolving the delivery processes as part of continuous improvement activity. You will need to provide agile coaching both internally and to our customers; helping to advance both our own and our customer's delivery capabilities.
You will partner with internal and external stakeholders, and partners to ensure services are delivered to customer expectations. You will ensure delivery of the work programme for the Corporate Technology service line to agreed deadlines and quality standards and with appropriate business continuity and disaster recovery protocols in place.
It is an opportunity to showcase your skills in a business that values coaching and mentoring, while enjoying working in a value-based culture with lots of other perks and benefits
Nōu te rourou | What you bring
We encourage and consider transferable skills and experience gained from outside of work e.g., cultural, community work, sports, volunteering, or a comparable role in a different sector or industry.
We want to hear about any of the following in your cover letter and CV any information relating to:

Ko mātou | About Us
Tatauranga Aotearoa - Stats NZ is a Central Government employer of around 1400 people across Aotearoa. We provide data and statistics to support the decisions of Government, Māori and Iwi organisations, businesses, NGOs, and New Zealanders. Our work is About Aotearoa, for Aotearoa - data that improves lives today and for generations to come.
Me pēhea te tuku tono | How to apply
We encourage you to be you in your application! We are truly committed to diversity, inclusion and lifting our cultural capability. You don't need to be knowledgeable in these areas, but you do need to be on board with learning.
Please reach out to us with any questions at rata@stats.govt.nz.
We will be screening applications as we receive them to move swiftly to interview shortly after the advert closes (depending on application numbers this date may change). You may be asked to complete a pre-interview screen via phone or video. Please let us know in your application if we need to make any specific accommodations during our process.
We encourage you to go to our careers site to learn more about working at Tatauranga Aotearoa Stats NZ.
unsolicited CVs will not be accepted, do not contact the Hiring Manager directly, instead reach out to jobs@stats.govt.nz
You must have the right to live and work in Aotearoa New Zealand. Background and various pre-employment checks are part of our recruitment process.

Description:
NZ - Ardmore

The opportunity
The Licensed Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (AME) is responsible for carrying out technical work as directed, to a high standard and in compliance with applicable policies, procedures and regulatory requirements.
Reporting to the Team Lead Ardmore Maintenance, as a LAME you will be part of a wider team which provides aircraft and component maintenance, manufacture, repair and overhaul services for the NZDF and civil customers. The role works closely with the MRO Planning team to ensure on-time service delivery to customers. You will have signatory responsibilities and may hold authorisations in compliance with regulatory requirements.
The holder of this role will attend relevant workshops in which Management by Objectives (MBOs) are established, and will support the Team Lead in the execution of AAP strategy and relevant MBOs.

About you
To be successful in this role you will need to live the Airbus Values, work with passion and determination, able to work to tight deadlines in an environment of continuous improvement.


Why us
We seek to inspire our people to grow, so you have the right mindset, behaviours and skills to thrive and achieve the organisation goals whilst being focussed on your personal development through classroom and online learning.
We value the health and wellbeing of our employees and offer true flexibility that allows you to balance your career with what is important to you outside of work. We will celebrate your successes and achievements with a formal reward and recognition program.

About us
Airbus in Australia Pacific is a leading aeronautical business employing more than 1500 people across 15 Sites in Australia and New Zealand.
At Airbus our people are the source of our strength. Our people work with passion and determination to make the world a more connected, safer and smarter place in the air and on the ground. We celebrate diversity of thought and we are committed to fostering a culture where our people are supported, our teams have the space and tools to be creative and have the courage to challenge the norm.

Supporting Diversity
At Airbus, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. Diversity is key to our ability to work cohesively as a team regardless of age, disability, race, sex, intersex status, gender identity and sexual orientation.
If this sounds like a role for you apply now!
Applications close… Sunday 16th April
You must be eligible for an internal Security Clearance and have the capacity to satisfy pre-employment medical screening which may include drug and alcohol testing.

OnFinality is the leading Polkadot infrastructure provider and is currently serving over 800 million daily RPC calls through its load-balanced RPC API service to thousands of customers globally. SubQuery is all about making the world’s decentralised data more accessible. We help blockchain development teams process and query decentralised data faster, allowing it to be used in more complex and intuitive applications.

The Company
This is a small team of technical experts who engineer Industrial Automation solutions for their clients.
With Directors who own and work in the business, the company culture here is one of ownership, passion for their people, clients, industry, and technology. This is a real tight-knit team that are adaptable to clients’ needs and deliver custom automation solutions that are both in-step with current technology and push the boundaries.
Mid to large sized manufacturers are their typical clients, but they are generalist, flexible and open-minded in terms of the client industry sectors they will tackle. Reflecting this, the industry sector someone comes from is not important to them specifically when hiring.

Job_title: Linux System Engineer - QA, Tooling, Automation
Description:
We are seeking a software engineer passionate about software quality, Ubuntu, and the open source community, to join the Ubuntu Quality Engineering team as we expand the set of open source packages we fully support and secure.
We see quality engineering as a first class engineering practice and are looking for people who can bring deep engineering insights to automation, testing capabilities, reporting and data analytics, as well as run processes in partnership with Canonical and community teams.
Ubuntu strives to deliver the latest-best free software components, in an easy to use and highly reliable form. We build on the technical excellence of Debian and bring additional focus and shape to the solutions we offer the industry.
As an Ubuntu Quality Engineer, you must be passionate about the future of Ubuntu, about quality and continuous integration and testing. You will work closely with multiple teams at the heart of Ubuntu and drive quality excellence. You will work closely with the Ubuntu Desktop, Server and Foundations team and put in place metrics for quality. You will research existing issues, troubleshoot and resolve problems, and identify opportunities for improvement and communicate them to the rest of the organization to drive the overall quality of Ubuntu.

Description:
Play a key role in shaping the future of banking at ASB
At ASB, we're all about doing what we can to help our customers get "One Step Ahead" by giving them the tools they need to manage their lives and plans for their families and future. Our products don't just serve ads or stream movies - they underpin our economy and touch people's lives.

If you've always wanted to apply your skills to a large-scale Kiwi success story, then today is your lucky day - as we are on the lookout for a Software Engineer to join us in our Fraud squad in the Financial Crime Platform.

About the role
We implement, configure, maintain and support the applications used by Financial Crime Operations to prevent and detect Fraudulent activity, keeping ASB and its customers safe from financial crime.

As a Senior Software Engineer in Fraud squad, you'll be part of our team that helps keep our customers safe. Being part of the Engineering Practice at ASB we encourage our teams to work autonomously in an agile way while actively growing their skills and expertise to continuously improve outcomes for our customers.

You'll have the opportunity to get hands-on with some interesting and complex pieces of work that integrate on an enterprise scale, all while being part of a smaller squad that makes their own decisions about how to work through prioritisation - so your voice will be heard, and your opinions valued.

Development support @ ASB is about building, operating, and maintaining our on-prem and cloud applications, with a focus on automation, uptime, and availability. We are looking for a mix of technical skills to support the following activities:


We advocate agile, fully cross functional teams which will take you through all facets of engineering in any given day. We are looking for a mix of technical skills, including:

In addition, the following would be an advantage:


ASB's sense of who we are and what we stand for is grounded in our values. They guide our business in our day-to-day interactions with our team, customers and community. They are what makes ASB - ASB.

Along with our interactions, values guide our actions and conduct, making ASB a safe and inclusive environment for both our people and our customers. They show that we care, are passionate and courageous, and that we act with integrity. Most importantly they unite us - because they are ASB.

We offer a flexible and supportive work environment and offer an open and inclusive culture; a place where we welcome and value your individuality, ideas and goals.

Description:
NZ - Ardmore

The opportunity
The Licensed Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (AME) is responsible for carrying out technical work as directed, to a high standard and in compliance with applicable policies, procedures and regulatory requirements.
Reporting to the Team Lead Ardmore Maintenance, as a LAME you will be part of a wider team which provides aircraft and component maintenance, manufacture, repair and overhaul services for the NZDF and civil customers. The role works closely with the MRO Planning team to ensure on-time service delivery to customers. You will have signatory responsibilities and may hold authorisations in compliance with regulatory requirements.
The holder of this role will attend relevant workshops in which Management by Objectives (MBOs) are established, and will support the Team Lead in the execution of AAP strategy and relevant MBOs.

About you
To be successful in this role you will need to live the Airbus Values, work with passion and determination, able to work to tight deadlines in an environment of continuous improvement.


Why us
We seek to inspire our people to grow, so you have the right mindset, behaviours and skills to thrive and achieve the organisation goals whilst being focussed on your personal development through classroom and online learning.
We value the health and wellbeing of our employees and offer true flexibility that allows you to balance your career with what is important to you outside of work. We will celebrate your successes and achievements with a formal reward and recognition program.

About us
Airbus in Australia Pacific is a leading aeronautical business employing more than 1500 people across 15 Sites in Australia and New Zealand.
At Airbus our people are the source of our strength. Our people work with passion and determination to make the world a more connected, safer and smarter place in the air and on the ground. We celebrate diversity of thought and we are committed to fostering a culture where our people are supported, our teams have the space and tools to be creative and have the courage to challenge the norm.

Supporting Diversity
At Airbus, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. Diversity is key to our ability to work cohesively as a team regardless of age, disability, race, sex, intersex status, gender identity and sexual orientation.
If this sounds like a role for you apply now!
Applications close… Sunday 16th April
You must be eligible for an internal Security Clearance and have the capacity to satisfy pre-employment medical screening which may include drug and alcohol testing.

Environmental Scientist
100% Aotearoa-owned environmental consultancy
Work on a range of exciting multidisciplinary projects
Sustainability is central to our culture

You may be an intermediate Scientist looking for that next stepping stone into a senior position, or an intermediate professional wanting to independently take on any challenge you are faced with. You will be surrounded by an inspiring, close knit team comprised of engineering, science, sustainability and water sensitive urban design knowledge.

Senior Cyber Security Engineer
Permanent role with Kiwi Company
Central Auckland Office

As a Senior Cyber Security Engineer you'll be responsible for managing and operating Cyber Security technology and products in Network, Platforms, and SAAS areas while adhering to standards and policies set by the Network Technical Manager and/or Cyber Product Owner.

You'll provide technical operational guidance, support, and coaching to the team to ensure that support service levels are achieved, quality expectations are met, and continuous improvement is carried out.



You should have demonstrated experience operating in cyber environments with large enterprises, managing Incident, Change, Requests, Cyber Product patching, Product Life cycle management, and Compliance audits.

If this sounds like a role you'd excel in, apply today via the prompts! Or email Paula Rae Broussard paula@momentum.co.nz or ring 027 500 2204
