Description:
Purpose driven and fast-growing specialist consultancy
Manage a portfolio of complex projects
Strong carbon management, energy reduction and sustainability focus

Ko wai mātou? Who are we?
Kia ora – we are DETA. Today more businesses are recognising the reality of climate change. Taking action on carbon is becoming a key differentiator for Aotearoa New Zealand businesses. DETA is a young, dynamic, and responsive organisation partnering with some of Aotearoa New Zealand’s largest businesses to identify, develop and deliver fundamental operational changes that are required to make transition to a low, or zero, carbon operation. We deliver services from business cases, to detailed design, through to project delivery. Essentially, we provide professional services to optimise business processes, drive improved performance and deliver lasting business value. We are committed to Aotearoa's unique dual culture/heritage and want to build a better tomorrow for our country.
For more information about DETA Consulting please visit

Our Reason for Being
Me mahi tahi tātou kia puāwai ai i te ao


DETA has offices in Ōtautahi/Christchurch, Te Whanganui-a-Tara/Wellington, Tauranga Moana/Tauranga and on the Sunshine Coast in Queensland, Australia.


You will be working with much autonomy but provided with the support and input that you need to succeed. You will be partnering with a range of client stakeholders in the dairy, food, manufacturing, and industrial processing sectors. Your engineering expertise will be focused on

This role will provide hands on process engineering and consulting experience and a rewarding opportunity to help clients decarbonise, reduce energy consumption and champion environmental sustainability.

We want to hear from you if you have.

Send us your application online today or email you CV to

If you wish to discuss this or other opportunities in confidence, please contact

Our client is a fast-growing healthcare technology company that provides innovative health solutions to improve patient outcomes and lower healthcare costs. The mission is to transform the healthcare industry by using technology to make healthcare more efficient, accessible, and affordable for everyone.

We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Product Owner to join our team and lead the development of health solutions products. As the Product Owner, you will work closely with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, designers, and business stakeholders, to develop and deliver high-quality health solutions that meet the needs of customers and align with the company's goals.

Responsibilities:
Define and prioritise product features and requirements based on customer needs and market trends

If you are a self-motivated individual who is passionate about improving healthcare through technology and want to join a fast-growing company that is making a real difference in people's lives, we would love to hear from you!

Job_title: Senior Front End Developer - Remote/Flex JOB ID - 127
Description:
Do you love understanding how data makes people happy? This fully remote global SaaS company has staff in New Zealand and in the US. The company's mission is to enable companies to build better products, and they do this by helping product teams understand and prioritize customer feedback. They use AI and visualizations to provide insights into metrics, their drivers, trends and specific improvement suggestions.
What you might be responsible for:
Building new features and maintaining existing product
Ensuring automated testing and CI/CD is helping us ship safely and efficiently
Validating and iterating on projects, making sure they are delivering what our users and customers will be delighted by
Collaborating closely with fellow team members to achieve team & company goals
Helping to decide on both the technical and product roadmaps, and helping us balance the two

We're seeking a Senior Security Engineer to join us, to work in a cross team environment improving and establishing security within our technology stack. Providing technical security subject matter expertise within the Squiz private and public cloud environments including networking, edge services, firewalls, web application firewalls, devops, containerisation and virtualisation, covering review, design and implementation of security measures.

We’re location-flexible! This role is open to all candidates on the East Coast of Australia..

For this role, we ask that you can demonstrate:
Expertise across a variety of security technologies like firewalls, networking, Cloudflare, SIEM, XDR, AWS.
Experience in Linux based environments (not a Microsoft shop).


Squiz helps complex, service-led organisations harness the power of digital, improving the services they offer online.
Founded in 1998, Squiz grew during the rise of the internet. Since then, we have evolved from a simple web content management system into a full digital experience platform (DXP), helping customers make the shift from being content managers to experience creators.
The Squiz DXP brings together content, search, data and applications in one place. To get the most out of the platform, customers can collaborate with our digital experts to design solutions and adapt as demands change.
We are headquartered in Australia, with teams and customers across the globe, and offices in New Zealand, the United States, the United Kingdom and Poland.
Why work for Squiz?
You’ll work with some of the most intelligent and down to earth people you’ve ever meet. We are made up of a diverse range of passionate professionals who love challenging the status quo. Every day is different, but what is constant is we all love what we do.
We have a lived commitment to flexibility, we know the success of our people is dependent on them having a balanced life. You will be offered flexibility as to where and how you work every day. We want you to be able to work in a way that drives productivity, efficiency and outcomes; along with connection and collaboration.
We celebrate diversity and unite on the elements of our company DNA, starting every customer conversation with “why?” to really understand their needs, working hard to find a way to overcome every challenge, and fighting for better outcomes with the work we do. We also check our egos at door, we don’t take ourselves too seriously and we have fun along the way.

We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

Description:
Our Purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.
The Nuts and Bolts
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices and generate an annual revenue of over $1.4 billion making us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT service companies. We have renowned expertise in operating data centres and providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant and notable clients so to meet their needs and in turn our employees’, Datacom understands the value and is committed to thehiring, developing and promotion of the very best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. At Datacom, nobody is just a cog in a wheel, with each individual treat as such as we attend to your specific development needs whilst recognising and prizing your personal contribution.
Why You Want to Join Us – Our Team and Culture, Benefits, Career Growth, and Flexibility
We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability. We’ve managed to maintain our local family feel whilst expanding globally across Australia, ASIA, US and the UK. In the regions we continue to grow and actively support local workforces and their families, and we are focused on being a great place to work to facilitate an environment that encourages our employees to strive to imagine what’s possible, challenge the status quo and put forward fresh, diverse thinking. For our employees, this results in such fantastic perks as:
Our Team
The TOC is a strategic and expanding team providing 24x7 support to ensure our customers get the best possible service every hour of every day. We offer an environment where you can bring your whole self to work. An opportunity for IT professionals who take pride in their work to thrive together, promoting continuous improvement and deliver excellent results. .
About the Role
The Associate Systems Engineers role is a varied one. We manage business and out-of-hours requirements for multiple resolver groups within our Platform Engineering business. We perform various tasks across a multitude of customers and a multitude of technologies including Microsoft, Linux, virtualisation, backup, Oracle, SQL and a variety of applications. We function within an ITIL framework and believe in standardisation wherever possible.



To be successful in this role, your technical experience should include:
This a diverse role that provides good insight into a number of areas within IT and is a great place to develop your skillsets and build relationships from within a great and supportive team. It is a 24x7 role so includes rostered shift work. If this is for you please apply now!

Description:
Mastip Technology is a leading supplier of hot runner solutions to the global plastic injection moulding industry.
Our head office is in Auckland, New Zealand where we have recently celebrated our 30th anniversary. Our solutions support many markets including packaging, homecare, electrical, electronics, appliance, medical, agriculture, automotive and optical.
We take pride in supplying solutions to the highest quality and purpose. Mastip has a strong R&D program delivering new solutions on a regular basis to strengthen our product range and ultimately provide the means to help our sales teams succeed through targeted marketing campaigns.
Mastip are looking for a Sales Support Manager to oversee our Technical Sales Engineers in Auckland. You will be responsible for the co-ordination of sales to our global distributors. You will be required to assist the team in providing solutions and quotations.

Mastip’s core ideals are communication, training and service. Sales support is key to implementing these and ensuring we are providing the highest level of service to our distributors and customers resulting in complete satisfaction.

Description:
Rocket Lab
Rocket Lab is a vertically integrated provider of small launch services, satellites, and spacecraft components. Our mission is to open access to space to improve life on Earth. Our team is over 1,300 people strong and we're adding to it every week. Collaboration is at our core – every idea is heard, and everyone makes a difference. Teams are nimble, decisions are made quickly, and we are action oriented.
Flight Software Engineer II

At Rocket Lab, our family of Electron launch vehicles and Photon spacecraft are supporting a growing number of ground-breaking missions in low Earth orbit and far beyond. Right now, our team is deep in the development of missions to the Moon and Mars for NASA, as well as the world's first private mission to Venus. We are looking for an experienced Flight Software Engineer II to join the team making these missions a reality.

In this role, you will play a key role in supporting the development of flight software for both our Electron and Neutron launch vehicles, as well as our Photon spacecraft. You'll spend your days participating in all aspects of software design and development, from requirements definition through coding and testing. And when we say test, we mean your software will be on orbit within weeks and months, not years. Thanks to having our own rockets and launch sites, we have frequent opportunities to test and operate our software on orbit.

This role is for someone who wants to see their software make a big impact on the way we explore space and use it as a platform for discovery and innovation. While your software settles into life in space, you'll be based in our Auckland Production Complex working amongst the rockets and Photon spacecraft as they're built and collaborating with the vibrant, dedicated, and talented people who have made Rocket Lab into the global leader it is today.

Job_title: Senior Full Stack Developer - Budgeting & Forecasting
Description:
Over the past 20 years Phocas has grown from a UK-based startup to a global organisation with nearly 300 employees around the world, headquartered in Sydney, with a Product & Development team here in Christchurch.
Phocas helps people feel good about data by doing the hard work for them, using the latest cloud technologies: serverless compute, lambdas, and in-memory data grids to produce high-performing scalable and reliable data pipelines. Our web applications are so data hungry that we push Javascript to its limits. We pick the best tools for the job: .NET or Java, AWS or GCP, Redux or MobX, Apache Beam or Hazelcast Jet.

We like to push the boundaries and consequently we've got a pretty unique opportunity for a senior full stack developer to help create the next generation of great financial planning and analysis products for the Phocas suite.

Description:
The Hadoop Admin will have a deep understanding of Java, Hadoop / Spark / Storm / No SQL / My SQL administration, security and troubleshooting.
The Hadoop Admin will be an outstanding communicator, creative thinker, and data nerd.
Responsible for implementation and ongoing administration of Hadoop infrastructure Performance tuning of Big Data/ cloud environment
Aligning with the systems engineering team to propose and deploy new hardware and software environments required for Hadoop and to expand existing environments.
Working with data delivery teams to setup new Hadoop users.
This job includes setting up Linux users, setting up Kerberos principals and testing HDFS, Hive, Pig and MapReduce access for the new users.

Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.
Our team
We're one of New Zealand's largest organisations, but unlike others we're extremely agile, we're kiwi owned, and we operate out of a large number of locations. Due to continued growth and new business we have an opportunity for someone to become part of our Wellington team, where you will be supporting both local and national customers.

About the Role:
This role is challenging, interesting and integral to the service we provide to our clients. As the Field Engineer you will be supporting a variety of different IT environments, at times on-site with our clients, providing desktop and engineering support. You will be working closely with our clients so outstanding communication and customer service is an essential focus in this role. Your professionalism will be a key strength together with your technical ability.
Due to the security requirements of our customers, this role is only available to New Zealand Citizens and/or Permanent Residents.



To be successful in this role you will ideally have had experience in a similar role, with a wide range of general IT skills. You will demonstrate excellent problem solving and communication skills. You’ll need to be a self-starter, with good organisation skills and attention to detail.
We look after our people and provide a great benefit package (Medical/Income Protection/Life/Trauma insurance) that includes parking. There’s no micro-management and you’re trusted to just get on and do what needs to be done.
The Nitty Gritty
We have over 7,400 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.5 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
If you are interested in being considered for this excellent opportunity, please apply- we are keen to hear from you!

Description:
Company Description

We all leave a legacy. What will yours be?

We are a team of over 56,000 specialists working across 7 continents to deliver some of the world’s most influential and transformational infrastructure projects.

Along with our clients and partners, we have one goal: to leave a positive, lasting impact on people and our planet. We’re driven by a common purpose to _deliver a better world_ .

At AECOM you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity and pioneering mindset are championed. You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work. You will be encouraged to bring your unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients, whilst being supported to develop your professional and technical skills.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future.

Our clients count on us to think without limits, partnering with them on projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, governments, public realm, energy and the environment, with a purpose to build legacies for generations to come. Graduates – with their fresh thinking and passion for reimagining what’s possible – are critical to our success.

Job Description

Our focus is providing GIS and data management expertise on large environmental and infrastructure projects, as well as developing systems – such as mobile data capture, creation of toolsets for analysis or data analysis platforms – so other AECOM disciplines can carry out their work.


Qualifications

Spatial Data, Data Science or GIS Degree -

Please note that you need to submit your resume, a cover letter and the latest copy of your academic transcript (please submit all as one document) .

Role start date is 19 Feb 2024

Additional Information

Our Graduate Program

Our Growing Professional Skills (GPS) graduate program is designed to help you bridge the gap between formal education and the workplace. The program is spread across two years, drawing on a range of personal development activities, exposure to other graduates and business leaders, and a range of topics designed to grow your business and professional skills.

Along with local site visits, technical seminars, mentoring, and internal and external training, AECOM connects you with leading local and global networks that help you learn, grow, and develop.

As an added incentive, your involvement in the GPS program is fully endorsed for those seeking Professional accreditation. If you decide to do additional studies, we will help you examine your options and identify areas of specialisation to support you in your career.

With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and there’s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.

AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

Join us and let’s get started.

Job_title: Sales Support Manager - Auckland, New Zealand Lead our Team of Technical Sales Engineers to Co
Description:
Mastip Technology is a leading supplier of hot runner solutions to the global plastic injection moulding industry.
Our head office is in Auckland, New Zealand where we have recently celebrated our 30th anniversary. Our solutions support many markets including packaging, homecare, electrical, electronics, appliance, medical, agriculture, automotive and optical.
We take pride in supplying solutions to the highest quality and purpose. Mastip has a strong R&D program delivering new solutions on a regular basis to strengthen our product range and ultimately provide the means to help our sales teams succeed through targeted marketing campaigns.
Mastip are looking for a Sales Support Manager to oversee our Technical Sales Engineers in Auckland. You will be responsible for the co-ordination of sales to our global distributors. You will be required to assist the team in providing solutions and quotations.

Mastip’s core ideals are communication, training and service. Sales support is key to implementing these and ensuring we are providing the highest level of service to our distributors and customers resulting in complete satisfaction.

Job_title: Senior Full Stack Developer - Budgeting & Forecasting
Description:
Over the past 20 years Phocas has grown from a UK-based startup to a global organisation with nearly 300 employees around the world, headquartered in Sydney, with a Product & Development team here in Christchurch.
Phocas helps people feel good about data by doing the hard work for them, using the latest cloud technologies: serverless compute, lambdas, and in-memory data grids to produce high-performing scalable and reliable data pipelines. Our web applications are so data hungry that we push Javascript to its limits. We pick the best tools for the job: .NET or Java, AWS or GCP, Redux or MobX, Apache Beam or Hazelcast Jet.

We like to push the boundaries and consequently we've got a pretty unique opportunity for a senior full stack developer to help create the next generation of great financial planning and analysis products for the Phocas suite.

Description:
Looking for a motivated person to join our diverse, enthusiastic and passionate team.
Work on a range of exciting multidisciplinary projects across New Zealand and Australia.
Roles from graduate to intermediate are available.
With significant changes coming to the water sector, we are looking for passionate, environmentally focused engineers to join us in the small waters team to deliver pragmatic, sustainable solutions that shape and co-create a more sustainable future.
What is the role?

Our purpose
Here at Datacom Data Centres' we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.
We are looking for people with practical skills that want to be part of an exciting business with new challenges and new people.
We provide comprehensive training to develop your technical and professional skills, and a career pathway to explore the skills needed for other roles.
E whakarato ana mātou ki te whakangungu i o pūkenga hangarau, pūkenga ngaio, me te whakarite huarahi kia torohia ngā pūkenga e hiahia ana mō tūranga kē atu.
Our policy is to promote from within, enabling opportunities for advancing your career.
Ko tā mātou kaupapa here he tautīnei mai i roto, kia whakawhānui i ngā āheinga kia kōkiri ai tō umanga.
About the Role
The role is based at our Kapua, Hamilton Data Centre and involves a rotating shift pattern.
The Data Centre Operator performs a large number of remote tasks and first level support tasks as well as installation of customer equipment, cables and cabling infrastructure.
We will train you to undertake scheduled and ad hoc tasks set out by the 24x7 Operations Manager and work alongside a team of data centre site leads and data centre technicians to provide the highest standards in operational deliverables.
About you
Role Responsibilities
Please note to meet our security requirements applicants must have the legal right to work in New Zealand.
Why you want to join us
At Datacom we believe that doing good, is good for business. We’ve maintained our local family feel whilst expanding globally, across Australia, ASIA, US and the UK. Our brand and reputation depend on ‘proving the promise’ and we aspire to be the trusted advisor for our customers across Government and the private sector from enterprise scale to regional business. We offer our staff a competitive salary package, fantastic perks and benefits like healthcare, life insurance, discounts at local retailers and a supportive, flexible working environment. If you want to join a company making a difference, apply now!

Description:
Company Description

At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.

We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.

Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.

Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future.

Job Description

We are looking to recruit a driven Transport Planner into the Transport Advisory team in our Civil Infrastructure Business in Hamilton. This is an exciting opportunity to join a team that has a great relationship and a great pipeline of work with key local and national clients. Reporting to a Principal / Associate Director you will be working within a team in a collaborative and open office environment.

AECOM Hamilton, and our key clients, have an exciting pipeline of work providing opportunities to work on strategic city-shaping projects including a significant amount of public transport, walking and cycling infrastructure planning and design projects.

In this role you will be working on a wide range of transport modelling with a key component of working with interdisciplinary teams and providing high quality and innovative solutions to our clients.

Qualifications


This role is an opportunity to utilise your current knowledge and understanding of transport modelling including some experience using modelling software such as Aimsun and SIDRA. As you will be undertaking data analysis, solid experience using Microsoft Excel will also be part of your current skill set.

+ 2+ years of experience in the field of transport planning or similar

+ Experience in Geographic Information Systems (GIS)

+ Understanding of theory and experience in Transport Modelling

+ Preferred but not mandatory working knowledge of Computer-aided Design (CAD)


+ Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering, Geography or Transport planning

+ Master’s Degree while not essential will be beneficial

Additional Information

Additional Information

With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and there’s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.

AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

Join us and let’s get started.

Join us and let’s get started.

Description:
Experience in paid digital media advertising, and love the FMCG industry? Read on!

ZURU is one of the fastest-growing and most disruptive companies in the world. A Kiwi grassroots start-up turned global, founded in 2003 by New Zealand EY Entrepreneur of the Year and World Entrepreneur Hall of Fame brothers Nick and Mat Mowbray after they left high school. ZURU has quickly grown to over 5000 + team members in over 30 locations. The company started in toys and quickly became one of the largest in the world, competing with comparatively historic household names by disrupting through automation and innovation. Award-winning brands include Bunch O Balloons, Mini Brands, XSHOT, Rainbocorns and Smashers. After so much success, the brothers took that model and applied it to consumer goods, creating their second division, ZURU Edge, and redefining the meaning of FMCG, becoming the fastest-growing consumer goods company in the world with new-age brands including MONDAY Haircare, Rascal + Friends, Dose & Co, NOOD and Bonkers. ZURU Tech, the newest division, is the company's moon shoot project where they endeavour to truly change the world by disrupting the construction industry. With 600 engineers working across 7 locations ZURU Tech towards the ultimate goal of disrupting how the world builds.

Description:
What is Polygon Labs?

Polygon Labs develops Ethereum scaling solutions for Polygon protocols. Polygon Labs engages with other ecosystem developers to help make available scalable, affordable, secure and sustainable blockchain infrastructure for Web3. Polygon Labs has initially developed a growing suite of protocols for developers to gain easy access to major scaling solutions, including layer 2s (zero-knowledge rollups and optimistic rollups), sidechains, hybrid chains, app-specific chains, enterprise chains, and data availability protocols. Scaling solutions that Polygon Labs initially developed have seen widespread adoption with tens of thousands of decentralized apps, unique addresses exceeding 225 million, over 1.2 million smart contracts created and 2.56 billion total transactions processed since inception. The existing Polygon network is home for some of the biggest Web3 projects, such as Aave, Uniswap, and OpenSea, and well-known enterprises, including Robinhood, Stripe and Adobe. Polygon Labs is carbon neutral with the goal of leading Web3 in becoming carbon negative.

Description:
Company Description

OceanaGold is a multinational gold producer committed to the highest standards of technical, environmental and social performance. For more than 31 years, we have been contributing to excellence in our industry by delivering sustainable environmental and social outcomes for our communities, and strong returns for our shareholders.
Our global exploration, development, and operating experience has created a significant pipeline of organic growth opportunities and a portfolio of established operating assets including the Didipio Mine in the Philippines; Macraes and Waihi operations in New Zealand; and the Haile Gold Mine in the United States of America. The gold, copper, and silver we produce are essential to the renewable energy and transport sectors, life-saving medical devices and technology that connects communities around the world. They also contribute to sustainable economic growth in the regions where we operate and direct employment for more than 2,500 people.

Description:
Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in.
Our team
Based in Network Operations – Our Network team are hands on and work beside various operational teams, project managers, developers and BA’s. Our skilled team have the confidence to work autonomously while also developing and maintaining strong working relationships with the wider teams and managing/engaging their stakeholders.
About the Role
Our continual expansion in the industry means that our Networks team is developing at a fast pace, opening the door to work with the latest of network technologies and delivering the best breed of solutions. This role will be situated within our Network Operations Centre where you will get to work alongside a dedicated network services group. We provide a challenging and sophisticated environment using a range of technologies to achieve our goals with a strong focus on Cisco solutions including, firewalls, routing & switching, UCS, wireless, voice and security. This role will be a full-time position with rostered on-call.
This role will be preferably located in our Auckland office.
What you’ll do
What you’ll bring

The Nuts and Bolts

We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
We’re looking for smart people, who get things done. If you are agile minded, passionate about technology and thrive in a modern trust-based environment then Datacom is the place for you!

Description:
At Datacom we connect people and technology to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for our customers and the communities we live in. Our Cyber Security Platforms & Solutions Team help our clients to navigate and take control of digital disruption for their businesses across New Zealand and Australia, by building, maintaining and enhancing the platforms and solutions our Security Operations Centre use to keep them protected.
We are looking for a person with a passion for Cyber Security to join us, offering you the chance to boost your career with excellent development opportunities.

About the Role:
You will primarily be responsible for security platforms and infrastructure related activities across a range of vendor technologies. You will be working within a team of passionate, innovative and engaging people who focus on building, delivering and supporting the latest Endpoint Detection Response (EDR), Vulnerability Assessment (VA), Security Information Event Management (SIEM), Web Protection and Security Orchestration Automation and Response (SOAR) systems for our clients.


You will help develop, manage and maintain our growing portfolio of service offerings using technologies from Crowdstrike, Splunk, Microsoft, Palo Alto, Zscaler and Rapid 7. You will help troubleshoot and resolve incidents on the platforms, to ensure our Security Operations Centre (SOC) have functioning environments and tools to help keep our clients protected.


The Person
You will be an enthusiastic team player who understands what needs to be done to provide outstanding service to our clients.
We are looking for someone who is passionate about the Cybersecurity sector and is looking to build a career in this space. You will have a solid understanding of networks, firewalls, proxies, SIEM, Endpoint controls, data loss prevention concepts and technologies. You will have at least 3-5 years’ experience in an IT technical support related role and ideally have exposure to security technologies such as Crowdstrike, Splunk, Sentinel/Microsoft Defender, Rapid 7, Palo Alto, Fortinet, Zscaler etc.
It is vital you have a solid understanding of ITIL and experience troubleshooting and resolving application and network problems. Exposure to Security Orchestration and Automation are desirable.
To join our team, you’ll firstly need to be a team player with a collaborative working style who communicates openly and honestly; a Can-Do Attitude is essential. Secondly, you’ll be technically strong and have the right attitude towards professional development. You will lead by example and guide your less experienced peers in delivering first class service for Datacom’s customers.



SALARY - A competitive salary package with annual performance reviews
BENEFITS - Extensive benefits including comprehensive wellness cover and access to services, such as free Medical, Life, Terminal Illness and Income Protection Insurance. Free access to: Financial Coaching, Wellbeing Coaching, Counselling, Legal Consultation etc. Discounts from leading suppliers i.e. Samsung, PBTech, Ingram Micro
DEVELOPMENT - A strong focus and dedication towards employee development. You will have access to online training portals, inhouse courses, vendor courses and support to complete industry certifications, with financial recognition for achievements.
OPPORTUNITIES - Excellent long-term opportunities to progress within a large scale, globally respected, IT organisation.
FLEXIBILITY - A supportive and flexible working environment in modern workplaces with a 37.5 hour working week. We support hybrid working from home and our offices.
If you’re ready to take the next step in your career, to join a caring and supportive team with a varied customer base, this could be your ideal role.


Due to the nature of our clients, this role will require that you can pass New Zealand security clearance. You must hold either Permanent Residence/Citizenship and have been in New Zealand or its 5eyes counterparts at least 2 years.

Description:
Mastip Technology is a leading supplier of hot runner solutions to the global plastic injection moulding industry.
Our head office is in Auckland, New Zealand where we have recently celebrated our 30th anniversary. Our solutions support many markets including packaging, homecare, electrical, electronics, appliance, medical, agriculture, automotive and optical.
We take pride in supplying solutions to the highest quality and purpose. Mastip has a strong R&D program delivering new solutions on a regular basis to strengthen our product range and ultimately provide the means to help our sales teams succeed through targeted marketing campaigns.
Mastip are looking for a Sales Support Manager to oversee our Technical Sales Engineers in Auckland. You will be responsible for the co-ordination of sales to our global distributors. You will be required to assist the team in providing solutions and quotations.

Mastip’s core ideals are communication, training and service. Sales support is key to implementing these and ensuring we are providing the highest level of service to our distributors and customers resulting in complete satisfaction.

Job_title: Senior Full Stack Developer - Budgeting & Forecasting
Description:
Over the past 20 years Phocas has grown from a UK-based startup to a global organisation with nearly 300 employees around the world, headquartered in Sydney, with a Product & Development team here in Christchurch.
Phocas helps people feel good about data by doing the hard work for them, using the latest cloud technologies: serverless compute, lambdas, and in-memory data grids to produce high-performing scalable and reliable data pipelines. Our web applications are so data hungry that we push Javascript to its limits. We pick the best tools for the job: .NET or Java, AWS or GCP, Redux or MobX, Apache Beam or Hazelcast Jet.

We like to push the boundaries and consequently we've got a pretty unique opportunity for a senior full stack developer to help create the next generation of great financial planning and analysis products for the Phocas suite.

Description:
Provide effective delivery of technology solutions'for ITS (Intelligent Transport Systems), Transport Technology, tunnels and roadside technology and Transport Operations Centre Technology Infrastructure
Great mix of communication and collaboration skills'
Wellington or Auckland or Christchurch based role
We are looking for a passionate and highly motivated individual, with sound technical knowledge, who can support the provision and delivery of intelligent transport systems technology solutions. Te Whiwhinga mahi | The opportunity The purpose of this role is to ensure the effective delivery and operations of transport technology solutions used within our Transport Operation Centers and tunnels across Waka Kotahi. You will have knowledge of video management systems, variable messaging systems, customer display systems such as EJT (estimated journey time systems), life safety systems, (HVAC, PMCS, Plant Monitoring Control Systems. You will be responsible for day to day technology environment management, monitoring of technology hardware operations including incident response through to restoration of services - this includes both traditional on-premises hardware and tunnel plant based technology. You will ensure service integrity, health and safety and quality of technology operations and support meets agreed business outcomes. We are looking for an effective communicator with excellent collaboration and relationship management skills. You will have the ability to collaborate with partner Agency technology teams and lead in best practice and innovative solutions. Ko koe tēnei | About you To be successful in this role, you will bring:

You will demonstrate knowledge of, or a willingness to gain an understanding of Te Ao Māori and promote tikanga and Te Reo Māori. You will also have knowledge of, or a willingness to gain an appreciation of te Tiriti o Waitangi (the Treaty of Waitangi) as it applies in the public sector. Ko wai mātou | About us Te Aukaha | Digital strengthens Waka Kotahi through supporting our people and delivering future-focussed solutions. We enable digital change and provide quality data, information and security services. Along with our other benefits we also have new Waka Kotahi Life, Income Protection and Critical Illness Insurance scheme available for permanent employees. As part of the review process we will be asking shortlisted candidates to complete a short Sparkhire video interview. View the Position Description here Rā Katinga | Applications close: 20 June 2022.

careers@nzta.govt.nz
To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.

Description:
The Company
Having been founded ~5 years ago, this incredibly successful NZ SaaS company is growing exponentially in their main market of the USA. They develop an AI/ML based software that improves productivity for doctors/nurses and patient outcomes for millions of patients in the USA. The company is already incredibly successful seeing customer numbers grew by ~15x in the last 12 months with a projected growth rate for 2022 of another 15x. The founders and very experienced in scaling global SaaS companies and are very well funded for the next stage of growth given they have just completed a funding round of > $20m.
The Role
Reporting to the Head of Engineering, you will be working alongside ~20 others in the development team. You will be working closely with five other developers who will be focused on development for the core product, with a Lead Developer for the Product Team on hand to offer support where needed. Your time will be split evenly between front and back end, so there is plenty of variety offered in the roles. The tech stack is quite varied although experience with the exact tech stack isn't essential - they are happy to support smart people who need to up-skill in certain areas.

Description:
We are now looking for a Principal level professional who specialises in carbon advisory and net zero to join our Advisory Climate Change team in Auckland, New Zealand, to play a lead role in developing and delivering our services in this area.

The successful candidate will have solid experience within a similar role and will be responsible for leading the delivery of climate change consultancy services for a wide range of projects, ranging from infrastructure whole life carbon assessments and climate change mitigation actions to climate change strategy, net-zero and advisory work. The role will include a mix of long-term and short-term projects and will play an important part in expanding the range and type of climate advisory services we offer.

Role Responsibilities


Take a lead role in broadening and developing our Carbon and Net Zero advisory services, including in relation to climate risk, transition planning, nature based solutions and the circular economy

Lead carbon and climate change projects and project teams, including those that involve whole life carbon assessments and carbon management implementation in infrastructure projects, across sectors.

Provide technical expertise and strategic advice to clients to align their policies, strategies, plans and business processes to achieve their climate change objectives, net zero ambitions and climate risk disclosure requirements.

Engage clients, and proactively support business development activities - identifying opportunities, positioning the team, and leading / supporting the production of winning proposals

Work collaboratively both internally with engineer domains and digital ventures and externally across client, supplier’s industry organisations and regulators


Contribute to management, mentoring and recruitment of junior staff. Line management is not envisaged initially but could be included as part of the role over time.

Description:
You left the office five minutes ago. Where do you want to be? If you want to live in a location where you can be on a bike trail, a golf course, a lake or river, or with your family within five minutes of leaving work then Central Otago provides this lifestyle.

Central Otago District Council has a unique opportunity for an asset management professional to set the direction for road asset management in an organisation that has embraced advanced asset management and is willing to try new approaches.

We are seeking a Senior Roading Asset Engineer to play a lead role in road asset management planning and strategy development to ensure our roading network meets the needs of the community now, and in the future.

Looking for a motivated person to join our diverse, enthusiastic and passionate team.
Work on a range of exciting multidisciplinary projects across Waikato, New Zealand and Australia.
Roles from Intermediate to Principal are available.
With significant changes to come to the water sector, we are looking for passionate, environmentally focused engineers to join us in the Waikato to deliver pragmatic, sustainable solutions that shape and co-create a more sustainable future.
What is the role?

Note: Partly is headquartered in Christchurch but has employees across NZ, AU and UK. The ideal candidate will be based in Christchurch full-time (if you're relocating, Partly will cover those costs) or be able to spend at least 50% of their time at HQ.
Our story
Partly's mission is to connect the world's parts and we're doing that by building the first global platform for replacement parts, starting with auto parts. Our big vision is to accelerate the world towards a sustainable future where waste is eliminated and all replacement parts are universally searchable, accessible and available to all.
Founded by ex-Rocket Lab engineers, we utilise cutting-edge technology to solve challenging but exciting problems that make a huge impact in a $1.9 trillion industry. We've more than tripled our team over the last 12 months and expect to double in size again over the coming 12 months. We're a global team spanning both Europe and Australasia.

Description:
Our Purpose
Here at Datacom, we connect people and technology to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in whilst embodying a culture of trust and respect for employees and customers alike.

The Nuts and Bolts
We now have 7000 people across our global offices and generate an annual revenue of over $1.4 billion, making us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT service companies. We have renowned expertise in operating data centres and in providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant and notable clients so to meet their needs, and in turn our employees’, Datacom understands the value of hiring, developing and promotion of the very best available talent. At Datacom, nobody is just a cog in a wheel, with everyone’s contribution recognised and lauded whilst their training and development is specifically tailored to suit their own unique needs!

Why You Want to Join Us – Our Team and Culture, Benefits, Career Growth and Flexibility
We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability. We’ve managed to maintain our local family feel whilst expanding globally across Australia, ASIA, US and the UK. In the regions we continue to grow and actively support local workforces and their families, and we are focused on being a great place to work to facilitate an environment that encourages our employees to strive to imagine what’s possible, challenge the status quo and put forward fresh, diverse thinking. For our employees, this results in such fantastic perks as:
About the Role
We are seeking a Platform Engineer to join our Platform team onsite at a customer location in Wellington (please do not apply if you do not live or cannot relocate to Wellington!). This is a blended role providing traditional BAU support primarily across the Microsoft technology stack (Windows Server, Azure, M365) that is transitioning towards a DevOps model focusing on Cloud, automation and containerization.
The key focus of the team is stability and availability of the client's IT environment to ensure all compute infrastructure services are available to the client business needs, whilst also driving technical innovation to support modern deployment technologies and delivery practices.
This role will suit someone with an infrastructure System Engineering background who is looking to move towards a DevOps role and gain experience across a broad range of technologies. The successful candidate will help drive technical innovation and adoption of modern ways of working. There is an on-call requirement.

Due to the nature of the Client you will be working with you will need to be an NZ Citizen/Permanent Resident and have the ability to pass additional government security clearances or have lived in NZ for the last 5 years.



•
What are you waiting for! If you are ready to make a difference in Australasia's largest homegrown technology company then apply within today!

Description:
Experience in paid digital media advertising, and love the toy industry? Read on!

ZURU is one of the fastest-growing and most disruptive companies in the world. A Kiwi grassroots start-up turned global, founded in 2003 by New Zealand EY Entrepreneur of the Year and World Entrepreneur Hall of Fame brothers Nick and Mat Mowbray after they left high school. ZURU has quickly grown to over 5000 + team members in over 30 locations. The company started in toys and quickly became one of the largest in the world, competing with comparatively historic household names by disrupting through automation and innovation. Award-winning brands include Bunch O Balloons, Mini Brands, XSHOT, Rainbocorns and Smashers. After so much success, the brothers took that model and applied it to consumer goods, creating their second division, ZURU Edge, and redefining the meaning of FMCG, becoming the fastest-growing consumer goods company in the world with new-age brands including MONDAY Haircare, Rascal + Friends, Dose & Co, NOOD and Bonkers. ZURU Tech, the newest division, is the company's moon shoot project where they endeavour to truly change the world by disrupting the construction industry. With 600 engineers working across 7 locations ZURU Tech towards the ultimate goal of disrupting how the world builds.

Description:
Rocket Lab
Rocket Lab is a vertically integrated provider of small launch services, satellites, and spacecraft components. Our mission is to open access to space to improve life on Earth. Our team is over 1,300 people strong and we're adding to it every week. Collaboration is at our core – every idea is heard, and everyone makes a difference. Teams are nimble, decisions are made quickly, and we are action oriented.
Flight Software Engineer II

At Rocket Lab, our family of Electron launch vehicles and Photon spacecraft are supporting a growing number of ground-breaking missions in low Earth orbit and far beyond. Right now, our team is deep in the development of missions to the Moon and Mars for NASA, as well as the world's first private mission to Venus. We are looking for an experienced Flight Software Engineer II to join the team making these missions a reality.

In this role, you will play a key role in supporting the development of flight software for both our Electron and Neutron launch vehicles, as well as our Photon spacecraft. You'll spend your days participating in all aspects of software design and development, from requirements definition through coding and testing. And when we say test, we mean your software will be on orbit within weeks and months, not years. Thanks to having our own rockets and launch sites, we have frequent opportunities to test and operate our software on orbit.

This role is for someone who wants to see their software make a big impact on the way we explore space and use it as a platform for discovery and innovation. While your software settles into life in space, you'll be based in our Auckland Production Complex working amongst the rockets and Photon spacecraft as they're built and collaborating with the vibrant, dedicated, and talented people who have made Rocket Lab into the global leader it is today.
